etymology.description: Depicts 心(心) (xīn, "heart") with a dot -> hole on heart indicates intelligence -> patterned shape 囪 in Han dynasty
etymology.interpretation: Initially, 悤(悤) (cōng, "clever") depicted a heart with a dot, symbolizing intelligence through the concept of 'holes on the heart'. This idea is rooted in traditional Chinese symbolism. Over time, its form evolved to a patterned shape during the Han dynasty, ultimately influencing the character's meaning shift but preserving its essence in 聰(聰) (cōng, "intelligent").
